    LineHitsSource
    1// This file implements a minimal subset of Abstract Syntax Notation One (**ASN.1**)
    2// Basic Encoding Rules (**BER**), namely the parts that are necessary for sending
    3// and receiving SNMPv2c messages.
    4//
    5// (c) 2012 Jakob Borg, Nym Networks
    6
    7// We define constants for the commonly used ASN.1 types in SNMP.
    8
    91var T = {
    10 Integer: 0x02,
    11 OctetString: 0x04,
    12 Null: 0x05,
    13 ObjectIdentifier: 0x06,
    14 Sequence: 0x30,
    15 IpAddress: 0x40,
    16 Counter: 0x41,
    17 Gauge: 0x42,
    18 TimeTicks: 0x43,
    19 Opaque: 0x44,
    20 NsapAddress: 0x45,
    21 Counter64: 0x46,
    22 NoSuchObject: 0x80,
    23 NoSuchInstance: 0x81,
    24 EndOfMibView: 0x82,
    25 PDUBase: 0xA0
    26};
    27
    281var P = {
    29 GetRequestPDU: 0x00,
    30 GetNextRequestPDU: 0x01,
    31 GetResponsePDU: 0x02,
    32 SetRequestPDU: 0x03
    33};
    34
    35// The types are also available for consumers of the library.
    36
    371exports.types = T;
    381exports.pduTypes = P;
    391exports.unittest = {};
    40
    41// Private helper functions
    42// -----
    43
    44// Encode a length as it should be encoded.
    45
    461function lengthArray(len) {
    47332 var arr = [];
    48
    49332 if (len <= 127) {
    50 // Return a single byte if the value is 127 or less.
    51326 return [ len ];
    52 } else {
    53 // Otherwise encode it as a MSB base-256 integer.
    546 while (len > 0) {
    558 arr.push(len % 256);
    568 len = parseInt(len / 256, 10);
    57 }
    58 // Add a length byte in front and set the high bit to indicate
    59 // that this is a longer value than one byte.
    606 arr.push(128 + arr.length);
    616 arr.reverse();
    626 return arr;
    63 }
    64}
    65
    661exports.unittest.lengthArray = lengthArray;
    67
    68// Return a wrapped copy of the passed `contents`, with the specified wrapper type.
    69// This is used for Sequence and other constructed types.
    70
    711function wrapper(type, contents) {
    72255 var buf, len, i;
    73
    74 // Get the encoded length of the contents
    75255 len = lengthArray(contents.length);
    76
    77 // Set up a buffer with the type and length bytes plus a straight copy of the content.
    78255 buf = new Buffer(1 + contents.length + len.length);
    79255 buf[0] = type;
    80255 for (i = 1; i < len.length + 1; i++) {
    81260 buf[i] = len[i - 1];
    82 }
    83255 contents.copy(buf, len.length + 1, 0);
    84255 return buf;
    85}
    86
    87// Get the encoded representation of a number in an OID.
    88// If the number is less than 128, pass it as it is.
    89// Otherwise return an array of base-128 digits, most significant first,
    90// with the high bit set on all octets except the last one.
    91// This encoding should be used for all number in an OID except the first
    92// two (.1.3) which are handled specially.
    93
    941function oidInt(val) {
    953 var bytes = [];
    96
    973 bytes.push(val % 128);
    983 val = parseInt(val / 128, 10);
    993 while (val > 127) {
    1001 bytes.push(128 + val % 128);
    1011 val = parseInt(val / 128, 10);
    102 }
    1033 bytes.push(val + 128);
    1043 return bytes.reverse();
    105}
    106
    107// Encode an OID. The first two number are encoded specially
    108// in the first octet, then the rest are encoded as one octet per number
    109// unless the number exceeds 127. If so, it's encoded as several base-127
    110// octets with the high bit set to indicate continuation.
    111
    1121function oidArray(oid) {
    11374 var bytes, i, val;
    114
    115 // Enforce some minimum requirements on the OID.
    11674 if (oid.length < 2) {
    1171 throw new Error("Minimum OID length is two.");
    11873 } else if (oid[0] !== 1 || oid[1] !== 3) {
    1191 throw new Error("SNMP OIDs always start with .1.3.");
    120 }
    121
    122 // Calculate the first byte of the encoded OID according to the 'special' rule.
    12372 bytes = [ 40 * oid[0] + oid[1] ];
    124
    125 // For the rest of the OID, encode each number individually and add the
    126 // resulting bytes to the buffer.
    12772 for (i = 2; i < oid.length; i++) {
    128499 val = oid[i];
    129499 if (val > 127) {
    1303 bytes = bytes.concat(oidInt(val));
    131 } else {
    132496 bytes.push(val);
    133 }
    134 }
    135
    13672 return bytes;
    137}
    138
    139// Divide an integer into base-256 bytes.
    140// Most significant byte first.
    1411function intArray(val) {
    142189 var array = [];
    143
    144189 if (val === 0) {
    14589 array.push(0);
    146 } else {
    147100 while (val > 0) {
    148236 array.push(val % 256);
    149236 val = parseInt(val / 256, 10);
    150 }
    151 }
    152
    153 // Do not produce integers that look negative (high bit
    154 // of first byte set).
    155189 if (array[array.length - 1] >= 0x80) {
    1562 array.push(0);
    157 }
    158
    159189 return array.reverse();
    160}
    161
    162// Functions to encode ASN.1 from native objects
    163// -----
    164
    165// Encode a simple integer.
    166// Integers are encoded as a simple base-256 byte sequence, most significant byte first,
    167// prefixed with a length byte. In principle we support arbitrary integer sizes, in practice
    168// Javascript doesn't even **have** integers so some precision might get lost.
    169
    1701exports.encodeInteger = function (val) {
    171189 var i, arr, buf;
    172
    173 // Get the bytes that we're going to encode.
    174189 arr = intArray(val);
    175
    176 // Now that we know the length, we allocate a buffer of the required size.
    177 // We set the type and length bytes appropriately.
    178189 buf = new Buffer(2 + arr.length);
    179189 buf[0] = T.Integer;
    180189 buf[1] = arr.length;
    181
    182 // Copy the bytes into the array.
    183189 for (i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
    184327 buf[i + 2] = arr[i];
    185 }
    186
    187189 return buf;
    188};
    189
    190// Create the representation of a Null, `05 00`.
    191
    1921exports.encodeNull = function () {
    19367 var buf = new Buffer(2);
    19467 buf[0] = T.Null;
    19567 buf[1] = 0;
    19667 return buf;
    197};
    198
    199// Encode a Sequence, which is a wrapper of type `30`.
    200
    2011exports.encodeSequence = function (contents) {
    202162 return wrapper(T.Sequence, contents);
    203};
    204
    205// Encode an OctetString, which is a wrapper of type `04`.
    206
    2071exports.encodeOctetString = function (string) {
    20849 var buf, contents;
    209
    21049 if (typeof string === 'string') {
    21147 contents = new Buffer(string);
    2122 } else if (Buffer.isBuffer(string)) {
    2131 contents = string;
    214 } else {
    2151 throw new Error('Only Buffer and string types are acceptable as OctetString.');
    216 }
    217
    21848 return wrapper(T.OctetString, contents);
    219};
    220
    221// Encode an ObjectId.
    222
    2231exports.encodeOid = function (oid) {
    22474 var buf, bytes, i, len;
    225
    226 // Get the encoded format of the OID.
    22774 bytes = oidArray(oid);
    228
    229 // Get the encoded format of the length
    23072 len = lengthArray(bytes.length);
    231
    232 // Fill in the buffer with type, length and OID data.
    23372 buf = new Buffer(1 + bytes.length + len.length);
    23472 buf[0] = T.ObjectIdentifier;
    23572 for (i = 1; i < len.length + 1; i++) {
    23672 buf[i] = len[i - 1];
    237 }
    23872 for (i = len.length + 1; i < bytes.length + len.length + 1; i++) {
    239575 buf[i] = bytes[i - len.length - 1];
    240 }
    241
    24272 return buf;
    243};
    244
    245// Encode an SNMP request with specified `contents`.
    246// The `type` code is 0 for `GetRequest`, 1 for `GetNextRequest`.
    247
    2481exports.encodeRequest = function (type, contents) {
    24945 return wrapper(T.PDUBase + type, contents);
    250};
    251
    252// Functions to parse ASN.1 to native objects
    253// -----
    254
    255// Parse and return type, data length and header length.
    2561function typeAndLength(buf) {
    257260 var res, len, i;
    258
    259260 res = { type: buf[0], len: 0, header: 1 };
    260260 if (buf[1] < 128) {
    261 // If bit 8 is zero, this byte indicates the content length (up to 127 bytes).
    262253 res.len = buf[1];
    263253 res.header += 1;
    264 } else {
    265 // If bit 8 is 1, bits 0 to 7 indicate the number of following legth bytes.
    266 // These bytes are a simple msb base-256 integer indicating the content length.
    2677 for (i = 0; i < buf[1] - 128; i++) {
    26810 res.len += buf[i + 1];
    26910 res.len *= 256;
    270 }
    2717 res.header += buf[1] - 128 + 1;
    272 }
    273260 return res;
    274}
    275
    2761exports.typeAndLength = typeAndLength;
    277
    278// Parse a buffer containing a representation of an integer.
    279// Verifies the type, then multiplies in each byte as it comes.
    280
    2811exports.parseInteger = function (buf) {
    282273 var i, val;
    283
    284273 if (buf[0] !== T.Integer && buf[0] !== T.Counter &&
    285 buf[0] !== T.Counter64 && buf[0] !== T.Gauge &&
    286 buf[0] !== T.TimeTicks) {
    2871 throw new Error('Buffer ' + buf.toString('hex') + ' does not appear to be an Integer');
    288 }
    289
    290272 val = 0;
    291272 for (i = 0; i < buf[1]; i++) {
    292533 val *= 256;
    293533 val += buf[i + 2];
    294 }
    295
    296272 return val;
    297};
    298
    299// Parse a buffer containing a representation of an OctetString.
    300// Verify the type, then just grab the string out of the buffer.
    301
    3021exports.parseOctetString = function (buf) {
    30376 if (buf[0] !== T.OctetString) {
    3041 throw new Error('Buffer does not appear to be an OctetString');
    305 }
    306
    307 // SNMP doesn't specify an encoding so I pick UTF-8 as the 'most standard'
    308 // encoding. We'll see if that assumption survives contact with actual reality.
    30975 return buf.toString('utf-8', 2, 2 + buf[1]);
    310};
    311
    312// Parse a buffer containing a representation of an ObjectIdentifier.
    313// Verify the type, then apply the relevent encoding rules.
    314
    3151exports.parseOid = function (buf) {
    31688 var oid, val, i;
    317
    31888 if (buf[0] !== T.ObjectIdentifier) {
    3191 throw new Error('Buffer does not appear to be an ObjectIdentifier');
    320 }
    321
    322 // The first byte contains the first two numbers in the OID
    32387 oid = [ parseInt(buf[2] / 40, 10), buf[2] % 40 ];
    324
    325 // The rest of the data is a base-128-encoded OID
    32687 for (i = 0; i < buf[1] - 1; i++) {
    327669 val = 0;
    328669 while (buf[i + 3] >= 128) {
    32917 val += buf[i + 3] - 128;
    33017 val *= 128;
    33117 i++;
    332 }
    333669 val += buf[i + 3];
    334669 oid.push(val);
    335 }
    336
    33787 return oid;
    338};
    339
    340// Parse a buffer containing a representation of an array type.
    341// This is for example an IpAddress.
    342
    3431exports.parseArray = function (buf) {
    3443 var i, nelem, array;
    345
    3463 if (buf[0] !== T.IpAddress) {
    3471 throw new Error('Buffer does not appear to be an array type.');
    348 }
    349
    3502 nelem = buf[1];
    3512 array = [];
    352
    3532 for (i = 0; i < buf[1]; i++) {
    3548 array.push(buf[i + 2]);
    355 }
    356
    3572 return array;
    358};
    359
    360// Parse a buffer containing a representation of an opaque type.
    361// This is for example an IpAddress.
    362
    3631exports.parseOpaque = function (buf) {
    3644 var hdr;
    365
    3664 hdr = typeAndLength(buf);
    367
    3684 if (hdr.type !== T.Opaque) {
    3691 throw new Error('Buffer does not appear to be an opaque type.');
    370 }
    371
    3723 return '0x' + buf.slice(hdr.header).toString('hex');
    373};

    1// Introduction
    2// -----
    3// This is `node-snmp-native`, a native (Javascript) implementation of an SNMP
    4// client library targeted at Node.js. It's MIT licensed and available at
    5// https://github.com/calmh/node-snmp-native
    6//
    7// (c) 2012 Jakob Borg, Nym Networks
    8
    9// Code
    10// -----
    11// This file implements a structure representing an SNMP message
    12// and routines for converting to and from the network representation.
    13
    14// Define our external dependencies.
    151var _ = require('underscore');
    161var assert = require('assert');
    171var dgram = require('dgram');
    181var events = require('events');
    19
    20// We also need our ASN.1 BER en-/decoding routines.
    211var asn1ber = require('./asn1ber');
    22
    23// Basic structures
    24// ----
    25
    26// A `VarBind` is the innermost structure, containing an OID-Value pair.
    271function VarBind() {
    28217 this.type = 5;
    29217 this.value = null;
    30}
    31
    32// The `PDU` contains the SNMP request or response fields and a list of `VarBinds`.
    331function PDU() {
    34104 this.type = asn1ber.pduTypes.GetRequestPDU;
    35104 this.reqid = 1;
    36104 this.error = 0;
    37104 this.errorIndex = 0;
    38104 this.varbinds = [ new VarBind() ];
    39}
    40
    41// The `Packet` contains the SNMP version and community and the `PDU`.
    421function Packet() {
    43104 this.version = 1;
    44104 this.community = 'public';
    45104 this.pdu = new PDU();
    46}
    47
    48// Allow consumers to create packet structures from scratch.
    491exports.Packet = Packet;
    50
    51// Private helper functions
    52// ----
    53
    54// Concatenate several buffers to one.
    551function concatBuffers(buffers) {
    56202 var total = 0, cur = 0, buf;
    57
    58 // First we calculate the total length,
    59202 _.each(buffers, function (buffer) {
    60518 total += buffer.length;
    61 });
    62
    63 // then we allocate a new Buffer large enough to contain all data,
    64202 buf = new Buffer(total);
    65202 _.each(buffers, function (buffer) {
    66 // finally we copy the data into the new larger buffer.
    67518 buffer.copy(buf, cur, 0);
    68518 cur += buffer.length;
    69 });
    70
    71202 return buf;
    72}
    73
    74// Clear a pending packet when it times out or is successfully received.
    75
    761function clearRequest(reqs, reqid) {
    7741 var self = this;
    78
    7941 var entry = reqs[reqid];
    8041 if (entry) {
    8141 if (entry.timeout) {
    8240 clearTimeout(entry.timeout);
    83 }
    8441 reqs[reqid] = undefined;
    85 }
    86}
    87
    88// Fix any OIDs in the 'oid' or 'oids' objects that are passed as strings.
    89
    901function parseOidString(str) {
    9118 if (str[0] !== '.') {
    924 throw new Error('Invalid OID format');
    93 }
    94136 return _.map(_.compact(str.split('.')), function (x) { return parseInt(x, 10); });
    95}
    96
    971function parseOids(options) {
    9856 if (options.oid && typeof options.oid === 'string') {
    9912 options.oid = parseOidString(options.oid);
    100 }
    101
    10253 if (options.oids) {
    1035 options.oids = _.map(options.oids, function (oid) {
    10431 if (typeof oid === 'string') {
    1056 return parseOidString(oid);
    106 } else {
    10725 return oid;
    108 }
    109 });
    110 }
    111}
    112
    113// Encode structure to ASN.1 BER
    114// ----
    115
    116// Return an ASN.1 BER encoding of a Packet structure.
    117// This is suitable for transmission on a UDP socket.
    1181function encode(pkt) {
    11945 var version, community, reqid, err, erridx, vbs, pdu, message;
    120
    121 // We only support SNMPv2c, so enforce that version stamp.
    12245 if (pkt.version !== 1) {
    1230 throw new Error('Only SNMPv2c is supported.');
    124 }
    125
    126 // Encode the message header fields.
    12745 version = asn1ber.encodeInteger(pkt.version);
    12845 community = asn1ber.encodeOctetString(pkt.community);
    129
    130 // Encode the PDU header fields.
    13145 reqid = asn1ber.encodeInteger(pkt.pdu.reqid);
    13245 err = asn1ber.encodeInteger(pkt.pdu.error);
    13345 erridx = asn1ber.encodeInteger(pkt.pdu.errorIndex);
    134
    135 // Encode the PDU varbinds.
    13645 vbs = [];
    13745 _.each(pkt.pdu.varbinds, function (vb) {
    13871 var oid = asn1ber.encodeOid(vb.oid), val;
    139
    14071 if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.Null) {
    14166 val = asn1ber.encodeNull();
    1425 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.Integer) {
    1434 val = asn1ber.encodeInteger(vb.value);
    144 } else {
    1451 throw new Error('Unknown varbind type "' + vb.type + '" in encoding.');
    146 }
    14770 vbs.push(asn1ber.encodeSequence(concatBuffers([oid, val])));
    148 });
    149
    150 // Concatenate all the varbinds together.
    15144 vbs = asn1ber.encodeSequence(concatBuffers(vbs));
    152
    153 // Create the PDU by concatenating the inner fields and adding a request structure around it.
    15444 pdu = asn1ber.encodeRequest(pkt.pdu.type, concatBuffers([reqid, err, erridx, vbs]));
    155
    156 // Create the message by concatenating the header fields and the PDU.
    15744 message = asn1ber.encodeSequence(concatBuffers([version, community, pdu]));
    158
    15944 return message;
    160}
    161
    1621exports.encode = encode;
    163
    164// Parse ASN.1 BER into a structure
    165// -----
    166
    167// Parse an SNMP packet into its component fields.
    168// We don't do a lot of validation so a malformed packet will probably just
    169// make us blow up.
    170
    1711function parse(buf) {
    17259 var pkt, oid, bvb, vb, hdr;
    173
    17459 pkt = new Packet();
    175
    176 // First we have a sequence marker (two bytes).
    177 // We don't care about those, so cut them off.
    17859 hdr = asn1ber.typeAndLength(buf);
    17959 assert.equal(asn1ber.types.Sequence, hdr.type);
    18057 buf = buf.slice(hdr.header);
    181
    182 // Then comes the version field (integer). Parse it and slice it.
    18357 pkt.version = asn1ber.parseInteger(buf.slice(0, buf[1] + 2));
    18457 buf = buf.slice(2 + buf[1]);
    185
    186 // We then get the community. Parse and slice.
    18757 pkt.community = asn1ber.parseOctetString(buf.slice(0, buf[1] + 2));
    18857 buf = buf.slice(2 + buf[1]);
    189
    190 // Here's the PDU structure. We're interested in the type. Slice the rest.
    19157 hdr = asn1ber.typeAndLength(buf);
    19257 assert.ok(hdr.type >= 0xA0);
    19357 pkt.pdu.type = hdr.type - 0xA0;
    19457 buf = buf.slice(hdr.header);
    195
    196 // The request id field.
    19757 pkt.pdu.reqid = asn1ber.parseInteger(buf.slice(0, buf[1] + 2));
    19857 buf = buf.slice(2 + buf[1]);
    199
    200 // The error field.
    20157 pkt.pdu.error = asn1ber.parseInteger(buf.slice(0, buf[1] + 2));
    20257 buf = buf.slice(2 + buf[1]);
    203
    204 // The error index field.
    20557 pkt.pdu.errorIndex = asn1ber.parseInteger(buf.slice(0, buf[1] + 2));
    20657 buf = buf.slice(2 + buf[1]);
    207
    208 // Here's the varbind list. Not interested.
    20957 hdr = asn1ber.typeAndLength(buf);
    21057 assert.equal(asn1ber.types.Sequence, hdr.type);
    21157 buf = buf.slice(hdr.header);
    212
    213 // Now comes the varbinds. There might be many, so we loop for as long as we have data.
    21457 pkt.pdu.varbinds = [];
    21557 while (buf[0] === asn1ber.types.Sequence) {
    21683 vb = new VarBind();
    217
    218 // Slice off the sequence header.
    21983 hdr = asn1ber.typeAndLength(buf);
    22083 assert.equal(asn1ber.types.Sequence, hdr.type);
    22183 bvb = buf.slice(hdr.header);
    222
    223 // Parse and save the ObjectIdentifier.
    22483 vb.oid = asn1ber.parseOid(bvb);
    225
    226 // Parse the value. We use the type marker to figure out
    227 // what kind of value it is and call the appropriate parser
    228 // routine. For the SNMPv2c error types, we simply set the
    229 // value to a text representation of the error and leave handling
    230 // up to the user.
    23183 bvb = bvb.slice(2 + bvb[1]);
    23283 vb.type = bvb[0];
    23383 if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.Null) {
    234 // Null type.
    23516 vb.value = null;
    23667 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.OctetString) {
    237 // Octet string type.
    23816 vb.value = asn1ber.parseOctetString(bvb);
    23951 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.Integer ||
    240 vb.type === asn1ber.types.Counter ||
    241 vb.type === asn1ber.types.Counter64 ||
    242 vb.type === asn1ber.types.TimeTicks ||
    243 vb.type === asn1ber.types.Gauge) {
    244 // Integer type and it's derivatives that behave in the same manner.
    24541 vb.value = asn1ber.parseInteger(bvb);
    24610 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.ObjectIdentifier) {
    247 // Object identifier type.
    2481 vb.value = asn1ber.parseOid(bvb);
    2499 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.IpAddress) {
    250 // IP Address type.
    2511 vb.value = asn1ber.parseArray(bvb);
    2528 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.Opaque) {
    253 // Opaque type. The 'parsing' here is very light; basically we return a
    254 // string representation of the raw bytes in hex.
    2552 vb.value = asn1ber.parseOpaque(bvb);
    2566 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.EndOfMibView) {
    257 // End of MIB view error, returned when attempting to GetNext beyond the end
    258 // of the current view.
    2591 vb.value = 'endOfMibView';
    2605 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.NoSuchObject) {
    261 // No such object error, returned when attempting to Get/GetNext an OID that doesn't exist.
    2621 vb.value = 'noSuchObject';
    2634 } else if (vb.type === asn1ber.types.NoSuchInstance) {
    264 // No such instance error, returned when attempting to Get/GetNext an instance
    265 // that doesn't exist in a given table.
    2664 vb.value = 'noSuchInstance';
    267 } else {
    268 // Something else that we can't handle, so throw an error.
    269 // The error will be caught and presented in a useful manner on stderr,
    270 // with a dump of the message causing it.
    2710 throw new Error('Unrecognized value type ' + vb.type);
    272 }
    273
    274 // Take the raw octet string value and preseve it as a buffer and hex string.
    27583 vb.valueRaw = bvb.slice(2);
    27683 vb.valueHex = vb.valueRaw.toString('hex');
    277
    278 // Add the request id to the varbind (even though it doesn't really belong)
    279 // so that it will be availble to the end user.
    28083 vb.requestId = pkt.pdu.reqid;
    281
    282 // Push whatever we parsed to the varbind list.
    28383 pkt.pdu.varbinds.push(vb);
    284
    285 // Go fetch the next varbind, if there seems to be any.
    28683 if (buf.length > hdr.header + hdr.len) {
    28726 buf = buf.slice(hdr.header + hdr.len);
    288 } else {
    28957 break;
    290 }
    291 }
    292
    29357 return pkt;
    294}
    295
    2961exports.parse = parse;
    297
    298// Utility functions
    299// -----
    300
    301// Compare two OIDs, returning -1, 0 or +1 depending on the relation between
    302// oidA and oidB.
    303
    3041exports.compareOids = function (oidA, oidB) {
    3059 var mlen, i;
    306
    307 // The undefined OID, if there is any, is deemed lesser.
    3089 if (_.isUndefined(oidA) && !_.isUndefined(oidB)) {
    3091 return 1;
    3108 } else if (!_.isUndefined(oidA) && _.isUndefined(oidB)) {
    3111 return -1;
    312 }
    313
    314 // Check each number part of the OIDs individually, and if there is any
    315 // position where one OID is larger than the other, return accordingly.
    316 // This will only check up to the minimum length of both OIDs.
    3177 mlen = Math.min(oidA.length, oidB.length);
    3187 for (i = 0; i < mlen; i++) {
    31926 if (oidA[i] > oidB[i]) {
    3201 return -1;
    32125 } else if (oidB[i] > oidA[i]) {
    3221 return 1;
    323 }
    324 }
    325
    326 // If there is one OID that is longer than the other after the above comparison,
    327 // consider the shorter OID to be lesser.
    3285 if (oidA.length > oidB.length) {
    3292 return -1;
    3303 } else if (oidB.length > oidA.length) {
    3312 return 1;
    332 } else {
    333 // The OIDs are obviously equal.
    3341 return 0;
    335 }
    336};
    337
    338
    339// Communication functions
    340// -----
    341
    342// This is called for when we receive a message.
    343
    3441function msgReceived(msg, rinfo) {
    34542 var self = this, now = Date.now(), pkt, entry;
    346
    34742 if (msg.length === 0) {
    348 // Not sure why we sometimes receive an empty message.
    349 // As far as I'm concerned it shouldn't happen, but we'll ignore it
    350 // and if it's necessary a retransmission of the request will be
    351 // made later.
    3520 return;
    353 }
    354
    355 // Parse the packet, or call the informative
    356 // parse error display if we fail.
    35742 try {
    35842 pkt = parse(msg);
    359 } catch (error) {
    3601 return self.parseError(error, msg);
    361 }
    362
    363 // If this message's request id matches one we've sent,
    364 // cancel any outstanding timeout and call the registered
    365 // callback.
    36641 entry = self.reqs[pkt.pdu.reqid];
    36741 if (entry) {
    36838 clearRequest(self.reqs, pkt.pdu.reqid);
    369
    37038 if (typeof entry.callback === 'function') {
    37137 _.each(pkt.pdu.varbinds, function (vb) {
    37263 vb.receiveStamp = now;
    37363 vb.sendStamp = entry.sendStamp;
    374 });
    375
    37637 entry.callback(null, pkt.pdu.varbinds);
    377 }
    378 } else {
    379 // This happens if we receive the response to a message we've already timed out
    380 // and removed the request entry for. Maybe we shouldn't even log the warning.
    381
    382 // Calculate the approximate send time and how old the packet is.
    3833 var age = (Date.now() & 0x1fffff) - (pkt.pdu.reqid >>> 10);
    3843 if (age < 0) {
    3850 age += 0x200000;
    386 }
    3873 console.warn('Response with unknown request ID from ' + rinfo.address + '. Consider increasing timeouts (' + age + ' ms old?).');
    388 }
    389}
    390
    391// Default options for new sessions and operations.
    3921exports.defaultOptions = {
    393 host: 'localhost',
    394 port: 161,
    395 community: 'public',
    396 family: 'udp4',
    397 timeouts: [ 5000, 5000, 5000, 5000 ]
    398};
    399
    400// This creates a new SNMP session.
    401
    4021function Session(options) {
    40345 var self = this;
    404
    40545 self.options = options || {};
    40645 _.defaults(self.options, exports.defaultOptions);
    407
    40845 self.reqs = {};
    40945 self.socket = dgram.createSocket(self.options.family);
    41045 self.socket.on('message', _.bind(msgReceived, self));
    41145 self.socket.on('close', function () {
    412 // Remove the socket so we don't try to send a message on
    413 // it when it's closed.
    4140 self.socket = undefined;
    415 });
    41645 self.socket.on('error', function () {
    417 // Errors will be emitted here as well as on the callback to the send function.
    418 // We handle them there, so doing anything here is unnecessary.
    419 // But having no error handler trips up the test suite.
    420 });
    421}
    422
    423// We inherit from EventEmitter so that we can emit error events
    424// on fatal errors.
    4251Session.prototype = Object.create(events.EventEmitter.prototype);
    4261exports.Session = Session;
    427
    428// Generate a request ID. It's best kept within a signed 32 bit integer.
    429// Uses the current time in ms, shifted left ten bits, plus a counter.
    430// This gives us space for 1 transmit every microsecond and wraps every
    431// ~1000 seconds. This is OK since we only need to keep unique ID:s for in
    432// flight packets and they should be safely timed out by then.
    433
    4341Session.prototype.requestId = function () {
    43543 var self = this, now = Date.now();
    436
    43743 if (!self.prevTs) {
    43833 self.prevTs = now;
    43933 self.counter = 0;
    440 }
    441
    44243 if (now === self.prevTs) {
    44333 self.counter += 1;
    44433 if (self.counter > 1023) {
    4450 throw new Error('Request ID counter overflow. Adjust algorithm.');
    446 }
    447 } else {
    44810 self.prevTs = now;
    44910 self.counter = 0;
    450 }
    451
    45243 return ((now & 0x1fffff) << 10) + self.counter;
    453};
    454
    455// Display useful debugging information when a parse error occurs.
    456
    4571Session.prototype.parseError = function (error, buffer) {
    4581 var self = this, hex;
    459
    460 // Display a friendly introductory text.
    4611 console.error('Woops! An error occurred while parsing an SNMP message. :(');
    4621 console.error('To have this problem corrected, please report the information below verbatim');
    4631 console.error('via email to snmp@nym.se or by creating a GitHub issue at');
    4641 console.error('https://github.com/calmh/node-snmp-native/issues');
    4651 console.error('');
    4661 console.error('Thanks!');
    467
    468 // Display the stack backtrace so we know where the exception happened.
    4691 console.error('');
    4701 console.error(error.stack);
    471
    472 // Display the buffer data, nicely formatted so we can replicate the problem.
    4731 console.error('\nMessage data:');
    4741 hex = buffer.toString('hex');
    4751 while (hex.length > 0) {
    4767 console.error(' ' + hex.slice(0, 32).replace(/([0-9a-f]{2})/g, '$1 '));
    4777 hex = hex.slice(32);
    478 }
    479
    480 // Let the exception bubble upwards.
    4811 self.emit('error', error);
    482};
    483
    484// Send a message. Can be used after manually constructing a correct Packet structure.
    485
    4861Session.prototype.sendMsg = function (pkt, options, callback) {
    48743 var self = this, buf, reqid, retrans = 0;
    488
    48943 _.defaults(options, self.options);
    490
    49143 reqid = self.requestId();
    49243 pkt.pdu.reqid = reqid;
    493
    49443 buf = encode(pkt);
    495
    49642 function transmit() {
    49745 if (!self.socket) {
    498 // The socket has already been closed, perhaps due to an error that ocurred while a timeout
    499 // was scheduled. We can't do anything about it now.
    5000 clearRequest(self.reqs, reqid);
    5010 return;
    502 }
    503
    504 // Send the message.
    50545 self.socket.send(buf, 0, buf.length, options.port, options.host, function (err, bytes) {
    50645 var entry = self.reqs[reqid];
    507
    50845 if (err) {
    5091 clearRequest(self.reqs, reqid);
    5101 return callback(err);
    51144 } else if (entry) {
    51244 entry.sendStamp = Date.now();
    513
    51444 if (options.timeouts[retrans]) {
    515 // Set timeout and record the timer so that we can (attempt to) cancel it when we receive the reply.
    51642 entry.timeout = setTimeout(transmit, options.timeouts[retrans]);
    51742 retrans += 1;
    518 } else {
    5192 clearRequest(self.reqs, reqid);
    5202 return callback(new Error('Timeout'));
    521 }
    522 }
    523 });
    524 }
    525
    526 // Register the callback to call when we receive a reply.
    52742 self.reqs[reqid] = { callback: callback };
    528 // Transmit the message.
    52942 transmit();
    530};
    531
    532// Shortcut to create a GetRequest and send it, while registering a callback.
    533// Needs `options.oid` to be an OID in array form.
    534
    5351Session.prototype.get = function (options, callback) {
    53624 var self = this, pkt;
    537
    53824 _.defaults(options, self.options);
    53924 parseOids(options);
    540
    54123 if (!options.oid) {
    5421 return callback(null, []);
    543 }
    544
    54522 pkt = new Packet();
    54622 pkt.community = options.community;
    54722 pkt.pdu.varbinds[0].oid = options.oid;
    54822 self.sendMsg(pkt, options, callback);
    549};
    550
    551// Shortcut to create a SetRequest and send it, while registering a callback.
    552// Needs `options.oid` to be an OID in array form, `options.value` to be an
    553// integer and `options.type` to be asn1ber.T.Integer (2).
    554
    5551Session.prototype.set = function (options, callback) {
    5568 var self = this, pkt;
    557
    5588 _.defaults(options, self.options);
    5598 parseOids(options);
    560
    5617 if (!options.oid) {
    5621 throw new Error('Missing required option `oid`.');
    5636 } else if (!options.value) {
    5641 throw new Error('Missing required option `value`.');
    5655 } else if (!options.type) {
    5661 throw new Error('Missing required option `type`.');
    567 }
    568
    5694 pkt = new Packet();
    5704 pkt.community = options.community;
    5714 pkt.pdu.type = asn1ber.pduTypes.SetRequestPDU;
    5724 pkt.pdu.varbinds[0].oid = options.oid;
    5734 pkt.pdu.varbinds[0].type = options.type;
    5744 pkt.pdu.varbinds[0].value = options.value;
    5754 self.sendMsg(pkt, options, callback);
    576};
    577
    578// Shortcut to get all OIDs in the `options.oids` array sequentially. The
    579// callback is called when the entire operation is completed. If
    580// options.abortOnError is truish, an error while getting any of the values
    581// will cause the callback to be called with error status. When
    582// `options.abortOnError` is falsish (the default), any errors will be ignored
    583// and any successfully retrieved values sent to the callback.
    584
    5851Session.prototype.getAll = function (options, callback) {
    5865 var self = this, results = [];
    587
    5885 _.defaults(options, self.options, { abortOnError: false });
    5895 parseOids(options);
    590
    5915 if (!options.oids || options.oids.length === 0) {
    5922 return callback(null, []);
    593 }
    594
    5953 function getOne(c) {
    5964 var oid, pkt, m, vb;
    597
    5984 pkt = new Packet();
    5994 pkt.community = options.community;
    6004 pkt.pdu.varbinds = [];
    601
    602 // Push up to 16 varbinds in the same message.
    603 // The number 16 isn't really that magical, it's just a nice round
    604 // number that usually seems to fit withing a single packet and gets
    605 // accepted by the switches I've tested it on.
    6064 for (m = 0; m < 16 && c < options.oids.length; m++) {
    60730 vb = new VarBind();
    60830 vb.oid = options.oids[c];
    60930 pkt.pdu.varbinds.push(vb);
    61030 c++;
    611 }
    612
    6134 self.sendMsg(pkt, options, function (err, varbinds) {
    6144 if (options.abortOnError && err) {
    6150 callback(err);
    616 } else {
    6174 if (varbinds) {
    6184 results = results.concat(varbinds);
    619 }
    6204 if (c < options.oids.length) {
    6211 getOne(c);
    622 } else {
    6233 callback(null, results);
    624 }
    625 }
    626 });
    627 }
    628
    6293 getOne(0);
    630};
    631
    632// Shortcut to create a GetNextRequest and send it, while registering a callback.
    633// Needs `options.oid` to be an OID in array form.
    634
    6351Session.prototype.getNext = function (options, callback) {
    63616 var self = this, pkt;
    637
    63816 _.defaults(options, self.options);
    63916 parseOids(options);
    640
    64114 if (!options.oid) {
    6421 return callback(null, []);
    643 }
    644
    64513 pkt = new Packet();
    64613 pkt.community = options.community;
    64713 pkt.pdu.type = 1;
    64813 pkt.pdu.varbinds[0].oid = options.oid;
    64913 self.sendMsg(pkt, options, callback);
    650};
    651
    652// Shortcut to get all entries below the specified OID.
    653// The callback will be called once with the list of
    654// varbinds that was collected, or with an error object.
    655// Needs `options.oid` to be an OID in array form.
    656
    6571Session.prototype.getSubtree = function (options, callback) {
    6583 var self = this, vbs = [];
    659
    6603 _.defaults(options, self.options);
    6613 parseOids(options);
    662
    6633 if (!options.oid) {
    6641 return callback(null, []);
    665 }
    666
    6672 options.startOid = options.oid;
    668
    669 // Helper to check whether `oid` in inside the tree rooted at
    670 // `root` or not.
    6712 function inTree(root, oid) {
    67211 var i;
    67311 if (oid.length <= root.length) {
    6741 return false;
    675 }
    67610 for (i = 0; i < root.length; i++) {
    67779 if (oid[i] !== root[i]) {
    6781 return false;
    679 }
    680 }
    6819 return true;
    682 }
    683
    684 // Helper to handle the result of getNext and call the user's callback
    685 // as appropriate. The callback will see one of the following patterns:
    686 // - callback([an Error object], undefined) -- an error ocurred.
    687 // - callback(null, [a Packet object]) -- data from under the tree.
    688 // - callback(null, null) -- end of tree.
    6892 function result(error, varbinds) {
    69011 if (error) {
    6910 callback(error);
    692 } else {
    69311 if (inTree(options.startOid, varbinds[0].oid)) {
    6949 if (varbinds[0].value === 'endOfMibView' || varbinds[0].value === 'noSuchObject' || varbinds[0].value === 'noSuchInstance') {
    6950 callback(null, vbs);
    696 } else {
    6979 vbs.push(varbinds[0]);
    6989 var next = { oid: varbinds[0].oid };
    6999 _.defaults(next, options);
    7009 self.getNext(next, result);
    701 }
    702 } else {
    7032 callback(null, vbs);
    704 }
    705 }
    706 }
    707
    7082 self.getNext(options, result);
    709};
    710
    711// Close the socket. Necessary to finish the event loop and exit the program.
    712
    7131Session.prototype.close = function () {
    7140 this.socket.close();
    715};
